DataElement.preferredName: Image Study Spatial Acquisition Type Code
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A coded value specifying the spatial aspects of the radiographic technique of used in a data collection.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A coded value specifying spatial aspects of the mechanism of data collection._A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Technique to produce 3D images to provide the ability to visualize important structures in great detail. Traditionally CT and MRI scans produced static output on film. To produce 3D images, many scans are made, and then combined by computers to produce a 3D model, which can then be manipulated by the physician. 3D ultrasounds are produced using a somewhat similar technique.

Concepts.definition: Technique to produce 3D images to provide the ability to visualize important structures in great detail. Traditionally CT and MRI scans produced static output on film. To produce 3D images, many scans are made, and then combined by computers to produce a 3D model, which can then be manipulated by the physician. 3D ultrasounds are produced using a somewhat similar technique.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CDS Coding Instructions
ReferenceDocuments.description:
For CT, this specifies the trajectory of the X-Ray source relative to the object being imaged, e.g. SEQUENCED, SPIRAL, CONSTANT_ANGLE, STATIONARY, FREE
For MRI, this specifies the spatial encoding scheme, e.g. 1D, 2D, 3D

DataElement.administrativeNotes: 2/5/24 Added Ref doc CDS Coding Instructions. BF;1/1/24 created for DEC 2023 CDS Imaging Template.  Incomplete pending terms for PVs sent to EVS 1/2/24. jk
